vectorData.altText: 2. In an upper motor neuron lesion, reflexes are ______________.
That's right!  Reflexes are normally suppressed by input from UMNs, therefore lesion will increase reflexes.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

The stretch reflex maintains muscle length. 
Passive muscle stretch triggers active muscle contraction.
Certain spinal levels tested with a reflex hammer, e.g.
C6 = biceps
C7 = triceps
L4 = patellar
S1 = achilles
Basic Clinical Neuroscience, 2e, by Young et al.,  2008.

The stretch reflex requires an intact reflex arc.
 a LMN lesion abolishes the stretch reflex.
Normally, the stretch reflex is suppressed by input from UMNs.
  an UMN lesion enhances the stretch reflex.
